column1: ,SAVEPOINT,The SAVEPOINT command is used to set a point within a transaction to which you can later roll back.,SAVEPOINT savepoint_n ame
column5: UPDATE products SET price = 40.00 WHERE category = 'Electronics'
column9: At this point, the DELETE is rolled back, but the UPDATE remains. COMMIT
column10: 0,ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT,The ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT command is used to roll back to a specific savepoint within a transaction.,ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT savepoint_n ame;,BEGIN TRANSACTION
column13: UPDATE products SET price = 50.00 WHERE category = 'Electronics'
column16: Rollback to the savepoint before the update ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT before_update
column17: At this point, the UPDATE is rolled back, but the INSERT remains. COMMIT
column18: 1,SET TRANSACTION,The SET TRANSACTION command is used to configure properties for the current transaction, such as isolation level and transaction mode.",SET TRANSACTION [ISOLATION LEVEL { READ COMMITTED | SERIALIZABL E }],"BEGIN TRANSACTION
column19: Set the isolation level to READ COMMITTED SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ COMMITTED
column20: SQL statements and changes within the transaction INSERT INTO employees (name, age) VALUES ('Emily', 35)
column21: UPDATE products SET price = 60.00 WHERE category = 'Electronics'
